section.title:
Table:
_categorystructure
section.para: Essentially a cross-join table that displays all possible category option combos, cross-tabulated by each category.

section.title:
Table:
_dataelementgroupsetstructure
section.para: Provides a relationship structure between data elements and data element group sets.

section.title:
Table:
_organisationunitgroupsetstructure
section.para: Another resource table that results from a maintainance operation. Orgunitgroupsets are listed across the crosstab axis, with each organisation unit listed in a row.

section.title:
Table:
aggregateddatavalue
section.para: This table provides the aggregated data that results from a data mart operation. Views for aggregate data reports can be developed with this table by linking to the period, organisationunit, and other main reference tables.

section.title:
Table:
aggregatedindicatorvalue
section.para: This table provides the aggregated indicator that results from a data mart operation. Views for aggregate data reports can be developed with this table by linking to the period, organisationunit, and other main reference tables. Note that for ad-hoc aggregation views where weighting will be employed, the numerator and denominator and the factor is provided. Otherwise, the <structfield>value</structfield> field can be used directly in reports or for operations where weighting is not employed.

section.title:
Table:
calculateddataelement
section.para: Stores calculated data elements and their formulas.

section.title:
Table:
caseaggregation
section.para: Internal table that stores information on how patient domain data elements should be aggregated.

section.title:
Table:
categories_categoryoptions
section.para: Relationship table that specifies which category a category option belongs to.

itemizedlist.title: Tables referencing categorycombos_categories via Foreign Key Constraints

section.title:
Table:
categorycombos_categories
section.para: Stores linkages between category combinations and categories.

itemizedlist.title: Tables referencing caseaggregation via Foreign Key Constraints
Tables referencing chart_indicators via Foreign Key Constraints
Tables referencing dashboardcontent_datamartexports via Foreign Key Constraints
Tables referencing datadictionarydataelements via Foreign Key Constraints

listitem.para: Universally unique identifier for each data element.
Primary name of the data element.
Alternative name of the data element.
The data element shortname is currently limited to 25 characters and must be unique. This field is used extensively in the GIS application and reports where short data element names are required.

In many countries, a code is provided for each data element. In many cases, paper data collection forms may have a code. This field provides a mechanism to link the "electronic" data element with those used on paper.
A full description of the data element should be provided here which describes what the data element measures, and how it is collected.
Specifies whether a data element is active or not.
Specifies the value type of the data element. Options include..
Specifies the aggregation type of the data element. Currently limited to COUNT and SUM.
Defines whether a zero values strored is significant, which infuences the aggregation process.
